name: mundanity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being very ordinary and therefore not interesting: He compares the mundanity of adult life with the excitement of childish fantasy. The town itself is astonishing in its mundanity.
More examplesFewer examplesA career on the stage has its share of plodding mundanity too.He talks about the relative mundanity of his day-to-day routine in the wild: waking up with the sun, eating leftover stew, chopping wood.Finally, after so much mundanity, delegates were given a thrill that brought them to their feet: first lady Laura Bush.
